boat.name: Marie Louise
boat.construction_details: Cold Moulded Mahogany on Oak Frames
boat.short_description: Built in 1978, an Oysterman 16, 'Marie Louise' is a regular winner in OGA events.

for_sales.sales_text:
LOA 22’, LOD 16’, Beam 6’, Draft 2’9"’, Displacement 1500kgm, Sail Area working 276 sq.ft., off-wind 490 sq.ft. Designed & built Paul Gartside, 1978. Glued double diagonal mahogany, a beautifully presented Oysterman progressively restored to high standard.

Cutter rig with jackyard topsail, Wykeham-Martin furling, slab reefing, all hollow spars, Noble.Nanni10hpdiesel (2009) 300hrs as new.

Recent tan sails, standing rig SK98 Dyneema, running rig Spectra and Dyneema. Raymarine Plotter, log/echosounder, VHF. Epoxy bottom & encapsulated lead ballast (900kgs). Sprayhood, cockpit cushions, winter cover, sea-legs.

Regular winner in OGA events. Set up for single-handed sailing. A joy to sail with impressive light weather performance. 4-wheel road trailer included in sale. Offers invited.
